Title: Ekong: ‘No distractions, Eagles are  focused on winning African playoff’
Summary: Ekong: ‘No distractions, Eagles are  focused on winning African playoff’ Captain, William Troost-Ekong, has assured Nigerians that the team is focused on beating Gabon to win the 2026 World Cup playoff . Ekong says the team will not allow anything to distract them from the mission .

Title: FMDQ boss hails market resilience, celebrates innovation, excellence
Summary: Chairman of FMDQ Group Plc, Jubril Aku, has said that market participants have continued to demonstrate remarkable adaptability and tangible impact in navigating an evolving economic landscape . Aku hails market resilience, celebrates innovation, excellence .

Title: ‘Nigeria needs to enforce human rights in business environment’
Summary: International human rights scholar, Prof. Uchenna Emelonye, renewed calls for an enforceable framework to mandate businesses in Nigeria to adhere to policies and a code of conduct that will entrench and internalise the protection of human rights .

Title: 30 years later, Amnesty Int’l seeks exoneration of ‘Ogoni Nine’ activists
Summary: Amnesty International (AI) calls for full exoneration of 'Ogoni Nine' activists . 30 years after they were killed, Amnesty International seeks their exoneration . The nine activists were killed in the Niger Delta in the 1970s .

Title: MOWAA denies claim to Benin Royal Museum as Police evacuate expatriates
Summary: CHAOS erupted on Sunday when a private exhibition at the Museum of West African Art (MOWAA) was disrupted by thugs . The exhibition, meant for investors, artists, and international guests, was being prepared for the museum’s official commissioning today, November 11, 2025 .

Title: Four Nigerians, others jailed 55 years over London phone robbery spree
Summary: Four Nigerians, others jailed 55 years over London phone robbery spree . The group, convicted alongside six other accomplices, received a combined jail term of 55 years following a ruling by Kingston Crown Court .

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, November 11, 2025
Summary: In the parallel (black/BDC) market, dealers in Lagos quoted the dollar in a wider band . In Lagos and other commercial centres, dealers quoted dollar in wider band of exchange rate . In Nigeria, dollar to Naira exchange rate today, November 11, 2025 .

Title: Trump’s Threat: Americans have right to defend Nigerian Christians  —  Babachir Lawal
Summary: The former SGF explained that defending fellow believers is rooted in Christian teachings . According to him, the concept of ‘Christian brotherhood” places a duty on believers to protect one another .

Title: Deceased Oyo teacher had cancer of the bone marrow, not beaten by students — Govt, NUT
Summary: The Oyo State Ministry of Education and the Nigeria Union of Teachers, NUT, Oyo state chapter, have cleared the air on the alleged beating of a teacher to death in Ogbomoso by students . They described the viral news story as fake and a complete misrepresentation of facts .

Title: Insecurity: NAF strikes kill terrorists, bandits in Borno, Kwara, Katsina, others
Summary: The Nigerian Air Force, NAF, has upped its counter-terrorism and counter-banditry operations nationwide . Airstrikes neutralised scores of Islamic State of West Africa Province, ISWAP, terrorists at Mallam Fatori and Shuwaram areas of Borno State .

Stop mistaking me for Anambra LP gov candidate – Kingsley Moghalu
